com.yantra.yfc.rcp

Class YRCApiContext

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yantra.yfc.rcp.YRCApiContext

  • public class YRCApiContext
extends java.lang.Object
    Instances of this class provide information required to call an API.
    See Also:
    YRCPlatformUI.callApi(YRCApiContext, IYRCApiCallbackhandler)

        The object associated with the key.

      • setUserData

        public void setUserData(java.lang.Object key,
                        java.lang.Object data)
        Utility method so as to uniquely identify the context.

        Typically used in the api call back handler.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to remember the data with.
        data - The object associated with the key.
        See Also:
        IYRCApiCallbackhandler

      • getException

        public java.lang.Exception getException()
        Utility method to get the exception which has occured during the api call.

        Typically this is not the exception which is thrown by the API, this is the exception which occurs on the client side when invoking the api.
        Returns:
        The exception which occured during API call.

      • setException

        public void setException(java.lang.Exception exception)
        For Internal use only.

      • isShowError

        public boolean isShowError()
        Returns:
        True if a error panel needs to be displayed if api an error occurs.

      • setShowError

        public void setShowError(boolean showError)
        Parameters:
        showError - True if a error panel needs to be displayed if api an error occurs.

      • getPrototypeCommand

        public java.lang.String getPrototypeCommand()
        Returns:
        The command to be invoked when the command set through setApiName(String) is defined to be running in prototype mode.

      • setPrototypeCommand

        public void setPrototypeCommand(java.lang.String prototypeCommand)
        Utility method used when the command has been defined to be used in prototype mode.

        This method allows the user to dynamically change the command to be invoked.

        Once set this is the command which gets invoked instead of the command set through setApiName(String) .
        Parameters:
        prototypeCommand -

      • getBehavior

        public YRCBaseBehavior getBehavior()
        For internal use only.
        Returns:
        The behavior associated with the api context.

      • isRemoveUEOutputWrapper

        public boolean isRemoveUEOutputWrapper()
        By default the output of a User Exit is wrapped on the same lines as the input, by backend code. RCP Infrastructure by default removes this wrapping and provides only the actual output of an User Exit. This is done whenever the apiName is invokeUE.
        Returns:
        True if User Exit wrapper needs to be removed by default.

      • setRemoveUEOutputWrapper

        public void setRemoveUEOutputWrapper(boolean removeUEOutputWrapper)
        By default the output of a User Exit is wrapped on the same lines as the input, by backend code. RCP Infrastructure by default removes this wrapping and provides only the actual output of an User Exit. This is done whenever the apiName is invokeUE.
        Parameters:
        removeUEOutputWrapper - Defaults to true.

      • getDelay

        Delay time in milli seconds after which the API needs to be scheduled.
